text: Charles Lane (born Charles Gerstle Levison; January 26, 1905 â€“ July 9, 2007) was an American character actor. His career spanned 64 years. Lane retired from acting at the age of 90. Lane is known for his roles in You Can't Take It With You (1938), Mr. Smith Goes to Washington (1939), Arsenic and Old Lace (1944) and It's a Wonderful Life (1946). Lane was born in San Francisco, California. Lane died in Santa Monica, California from natural causes, aged 102. ==References== ==Other websites== * * * Charles Lane, Hollywood Character Actor, Dies at 102 Category:1905 births Category:2007 deaths Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:American stage actors Category:American voice actors Category:American centenarians Category:Actors from San Francisco
title: Charles Lane
